Literature Review: The discovery of the cGAS-STING pathway has revealed a conserved mechanism of nucleotide second messenger signaling in antiviral defense across eukaryotes and prokaryotes. This review aims to summarize the current understanding of the origins and mechanisms of this pathway, highlighting the biochemical, structural, and mechanistic details of cGAS-STING, cGLR signaling, and CBASS. The shared machinery of innate immunity across domains of life underscores the importance of understanding the evolutionary pressures that have shaped the development of antiviral defense mechanisms.
